job.name: Azure_Databricks_Delete_Spark_Cluster

variable.description: The subscription id of your Microsoft Azure account.
variable.name: SUBSCRIPTION_ID

variable.description: The tenant id of your Microsoft Azure account.
variable.name: TENANT_ID

variable.description: ID of a Azure client application.
variable.name: APP_ID

variable.description: Secret key of the Azure client application.
variable.name: PASSWORD

variable.description: Hidden variable that contains the authentication endpoint of Azure REST API.
variable.name: AUTHENTICATION_ENDPOINT

variable.description: Hidden variable that contains the REST endpoint for managing Azure HDInsight clusters.
variable.name: MANAGEMENT_ENDPOINT

variable.description: Name of the Resource Group to be deleted.
variable.name: RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME

variable.description: Name of the Deployment (of Databricks workspace) to be deleted.
variable.name: DEPLOYMENT_NAME

variable.description: URL of the Databricks workspace to be deleted.
variable.name: DATABRICKS_WORKSPACE_URL

variable.description: Name of the Spark cluster to be deleted.
variable.name: SPARK_CLUSTER_NAME

variable.description: ID of the Spark cluster to be deleted.
variable.name: SPARK_CLUSTER_ID

job.description: A workflow that uses Azure REST API to delete a Databricks Spark cluster and associated resources. Once the deletion operation is enacted, the workflow waits until the cluster is effectively deleted.

task.name: ad_token_for_azure_databricks
task.description: A task performing a POST request to Azure REST API in order to authenticate to Azure Active Directory (AD) and acquire an authentication token for Databricks REST operations.

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: Content-Type of the request
variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE

variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.
variable.name: REQUEST_BODY

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description:
Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)
variable.name: RESPONSE_FORMAT

variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation
variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH

script.code:
import groovy.json.*
// =========== Manage Azure Access token ============ def slurper = new JsonSlurper() jsonData = slurper.parseText(JsonOutput.toJson(result))
access_token=jsonData.access_token variables.put("AZURE_DATABRICKS_ACCESS_TOKEN",access_token) println variables.get("AZURE_DATABRICKS_ACCESS_TOKEN")
expires_on=jsonData.expires_on variables.put("AZURE_DATABRICKS_ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRES_ON",expires_on) println variables.get("AZURE_DATABRICKS_ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRES_ON")

task.name: delete_databricks_spark_cluster
task.description:
A task performing a POST request to Azure Databricks REST API, in order to delete a Databricks Spark cluster.
This task requires the Azure authentication token provided by the task "ad_token_for_azure_databricks".

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description: Content-Type of the request, should be "application/json" with eventual encoding.
variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE

variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.
variable.name: REQUEST_BODY

variable.description:
Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)
variable.name: RESPONSE_FORMAT

variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation
variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH

variable.description: Additional headers of the request, provided as a JSON key/value structure. Headers can also be specified by adding HEADER_headername variables.
variable.name: HEADERS

task.name: ad_token_for_azure_resources
task.description: A task performing a POST request to Azure REST API in order to authenticate to Azure and acquire an authentication token.

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: Content-Type of the request
variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE

variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.
variable.name: REQUEST_BODY

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description:
Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)
variable.name: RESPONSE_FORMAT

variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation
variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH

script.code:
import groovy.json.*
// =========== Manage Azure Access token ============ def slurper = new JsonSlurper() jsonData = slurper.parseText(JsonOutput.toJson(result))
access_token=jsonData.access_token variables.put("ACCESS_TOKEN",access_token) println variables.get("ACCESS_TOKEN")
expires_on=jsonData.expires_on variables.put("EXPIRES_ON",expires_on) println variables.get("EXPIRES_ON")

task.name: delete_resource_group
task.description:
A task performing a DELETE request to Azure REST API in order to remove a resource group, which name is given as input.
This task requires the Azure authentication token provided by the task "ad_token_for_azure_resources".

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: Content-Type of the request
variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE

variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.
variable.name: REQUEST_BODY

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation
variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH

variable.description: HTTP Authorization request header that contains the credentials to authenticate the user to the server
variable.name: HEADER_Authorization

task.name: delete_databricks_deployment
task.description:
A task performing a DELETE request to Azure REST API in order to undeploy a Databricks Workspace, which name is given as input.
This task requires the Azure authentication token provided by the task "ad_token_for_azure_resources".

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: Content-Type of the request
variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE

variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.
variable.name: REQUEST_BODY

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation
variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH

variable.description: HTTP Authorization request header that contains the credentials to authenticate the user to the server
variable.name: HEADER_Authorization

task.name: check_delete_operation
task.description:
A task that performs iteratively a GET request to Azure REST API, in order to get information about the status of the resource group deletion.
This task requires the Azure authentication token provided by the task "ad_token_for_azure_resources".

variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.
variable.name: ENDPOINT

variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)
variable.name: PATH

variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification
variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK

variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.
variable.name: DEBUG

variable.description: HTTP Authorization request header that contains the credentials to authenticate the user to the server
variable.name: HEADER_Authorization
